title: Which photography umbrella should I use? - Quora

response.answer_text: The one that gives you the light that you want. A larger umbrella is going to give you softer light. A white bounce umbrella is going to give softer light than a silver bounce umbrella of the same size, but you’re going to lose power. A white shoot-thru is going to be even softer but in a small room you’re going to have a lot of spill which is going to affect the exposure. My favorite umbrellas are the Paul C Buff PLM system. I have several, but I mostly use a 64″ soft silver PLM with a front diffuser. This gives a very similar light to a large octobox but is much easier to transport.

The newer umbrellas now have fiberglass spokes which is helpful if used outside and they get blown over in the wind. I’ve had several umbrellas with metal spokes bend under these conditions. And once they bend they are practically useless! Be careful not to go too big in size as the steel shaft that the spokes connect to still isn’t strong enough in my opinion. See my blog post: Westcott 7 foot Parabolic Umbrella worth the money? — Landen Ohio Portrait Photographer | L David Likes
